title: Quiz 2 - Statement Assumption
instruction: Directions: A statement is given followed by several assumptions. An assumption is something assumed or taken for granted. Read the statement carefully and decide which of the assumptions are implicit in the statement.

quiz.text: Statement: "Do not lean out of the door of the train.” - a warning on a Mumbai train.   Assumptions: I. Leaning out of a running train is dangerous. II. Youngsters do not pay any heed to such warnings.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: Young boys will think many times before asking for admission in MBA colleges if employment is kept apart from diploma courses. Assumptions: I. Girls do not try to seek employment. II. Diploma is not correlated with employment.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: The government has decided to pay compensation to the tune of Rs. 2 lakhs to the family members of those who are killed in the recent floods. Assumptions: I. The government has enough funds to meet the expenses for compensation. II. There may be a reduction in the incidents of deaths caused due to floods soon.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: Apart from the entertainment value of YouTube, its educational value cannot be ignored. Assumptions: I. People take YouTube to be a means of entertainment only. II. The educational value of YouTube is not realized properly.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: The employee association has appealed to the General manager of Company ABC to introduce Descriptive writing examinations for clerical cadre recruitment to prevent the selection of incompetent persons. Assumptions: I. So far Company ABC used to select candidates without conducting a descriptive writing examination. II. A written examination can help to identify competent persons. III. At the higher level, written examination may not be of much use.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption I & II is implicit
If only assumption II & III is implicit
If only assumption III is implicit
If all assumptions are implicit

quiz.text: Scientists suggest that adults need at least 6-8 hours of sleep each night to be well rested. Assumptions: I). Not getting enough sleep can lead to diminished brain performance. II). People are now sleeping less than they did in the past.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: Gold price touched an eight-year high of over Rs. 50,000 per 10 grams of 24k gold and experts expect the price of the yellow metal to go up in the future. If we compare gold with bond yield, still the ratio is very low, so gold has a lot of steam left to go much higher. Assumptions: I. Yellow metal is performing better as an investment option in comparison to bonds, mutual funds. II. Many global investors are looking for safer investment options including gold as fears over a recession continue to grow.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: When forces like Special Frontier Force (SFF) are set up, some and some innocents suffer. But we should be satisfied with the success of this” -stated a citizen of an area where this force has launched its operation. Assumption: I: It is seen in the larger interest of the society, agonies of the innocent are a small price to pay. II: It is quite difficult for SFF to get the desired results without any negative impact.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: The starvation deaths in the Rohilkhand region are shocking. Such incidents should make people who waste food instead of sharing with the poor, feel ashamed. Assumption I: The people who waste food are not ashamed. II: All people are not aware of the shocking starvation death in the region.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Many trust Grammarly’s free writing app to make their messages, documents, and posts clear, mistake-free, and effective which are beneficial for their personal and professional purposes. Assumptions: I). People generally commit mistakes while writing documents, posts, etc. II). There are no other grammar-checking apps available for free. III). People who are not good at written English only use Grammarly.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption I & II is implicit
If only assumption II & III is implicit
If only assumption III is implicit
If all assumptions are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: 'Several labour and industrial courts in this State have no proper premises. Vacancies of judges and stenos are kept pending.' - A statement of a retired judge of State A. Assumptions: I: An adequate number of staff and judges helps in the smooth functioning of the industrial and labour courts. II: The State may not bothered about the condition of the labour and industrial courts. III: Physical facilities of an office help in increasing efficiency of its employees.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption I & II is implicit
If only assumption II & III is implicit
If only assumption III is implicit
If all assumptions are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: Considering the tickets sold during the last seven days, the cinema authorities decided to continue the show for another fortnight which includes two weekends. Assumptions: I: People may not turn up on weekdays. II: The average number of people who will be visiting theaters will be more or less the same as that of the last seven days. III: There may not be enough response at other places.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption I & II is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If only assumption II & III is implicit
If all assumptions are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: The simplest and the most cost-effective way to upgrade your home by giving it a new colour and at a 25 percent discount.' - An advertisement by a Paint company. Assumptions: I: Nowadays, there is no demand for paint products unless some attractive scheme is offered. II: Some customers always desire to have the best quality and do not bother either for cost or for convenience. III: Some customers want to keep their homes up to date at a reasonable cost and with fewer hassles.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption I & II is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If only assumption III is implicit
If all assumptions are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: The State Government has unilaterally increased 3 percent octroi on all commodities entering the state without seeking approval from the Central Government. Assumptions: I: The Central Government may agree to support the State Government's decision. II: The State Government may be able to earn a considerable amount through the additional octroi.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: "If you want timely completion of work, provide independent cabins," – An employee to the manager of the company. Assumptions: I: There are enough cabins. II: Others' presence hinders the timely completion of work.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statements: “It is alarming to note that only 55 to 65 percent of the voters are actually voting in State A‟. The government must make it mandatory for all to exercise their franchise in order to make the democracy more meaningful.” – View of a voter Assumption: I. Increase in the participation of voters will ensure an increase in the rationality of the democratic setup. II. Making it “Mandatory for all to exercise their franchise‟ will provide corruption free environment
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: In view of the recent spurt in oil prices in the global market the government is looking for alternatives. Assumptions: I. Oil prices will remain higher for a longer time. II. High oil prices may impact economic growth. III. Alternatives to oil prices are cheap.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption I & II is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If only assumption III is implicit
If all assumptions are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: Raman decided to get the Hotel reservation in advance for the trip to Shimla in October. Assumptions: I. Hotel rates may increase next month  III. There will be increase in tourists next month
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement:” Although no war was witnessed during the tenure of prime ministership of Mr. A, many top bravery medals were conferred upon many cops in the name of curbing terrorism and eliminating terrorists of different organizations belonging to our own states.” – news channel Assumption: I. It is disgraceful of cops to name the act of killing terrorists of our own country as an act of bravery II. A war is less harmful to a country than the menace of terrorism.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: The driver of the truck pulled the emergency brakes to avoid hitting the bus which suddenly came in front of the truck. Assumptions  I. The bus driver may be able to steer his vehicle away from the oncoming truck.  II. The truck driver may be able to stop the truck before it hits the bus.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: A sentence in the letter to the candidates called for interview – ‘You have to bear your expenses on travel etc.’ Assumptions: I. If not clarified, all the candidates may claim reimbursement of expenses. II. Many organizations reimburse expenses on travel to candidates called for interview.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: Nobody can predict how long our country would take to contain the unfortunate and disastrous naxalist activities. Assumptions: I: It is impossible to put an end to naxalist activities II: Efforts to control the naxalist activities are on.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: Anju's father instructed him to return home by metro if it rains heavily. Assumptions: I. The metros may ply even if it rains heavily. II. Anju may not be able to decide himself if it rains heavily.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: It is not true that the mightiest superpower always wins wars and gets accolades from other countries. Assumptions: I. Winners are sometimes admired and appreciated. II. Winners are occasionally criticized.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: Statement: In the recently held Conference on 'Attracting investment for MSMEs of manufacturing sector' surprisingly attracted a large number of participants and also received very good media coverage in the leading newspapers. Assumptions: I. People were not expecting such an encouraging response for manufacturing sector. II. Manufacturing sector is not managed properly in India. III. Media is always very positive towards the manufacturing sector.
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption I & II is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If only assumption III is implicit
If all assumptions are implicit
